intro: Polygala sinaloae, commonly known as the Sinaloa milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a unique structure that resembles a spurred shape. Polygala sinaloae is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and ecological significance in its native habitat.
